triplets: Watercraft designed for traveling on water for transport, recreation, fishing, or commercial purposes
Water transportation, leisure activities, fishing, rescue operations, and cargo or passenger movement
Hull and structure typically made of wood, metal, fiberglass, or composite materials; additional components may include ropes, sails, and electronics
Hull, the main body providing buoyancy and stability
Deck, the flat surface for standing or operating the boat
Varies depending on manufacturer and purpose; common colors include white, blue, red, and metallic finishes
Maritime transportation systems, recreational water sports, fishing industries, and rescue or patrol services
Various manufacturers producing recreational, commercial, and industrial boats
Typically 500–20,000 kg depending on size, type, and construction materials
Approximately 1–10 meters depending on type and design
Typically 10–50 years depending on material quality, usage, and maintenance
